title: Remove separate Strategy Session nav link and open Strategy Session page from Book Strategy Call CTA

requirements.text: Remove the separate "Strategy Session" navigation link so users are not presented with a standalone menu entry for the Strategy Session page.

quotes: do not need a seperate stratergy session link. The page should open on Book Stratergy Call button from all pages

acceptanceCriteria: Top navigation (desktop and mobile) no longer displays a link labeled "Strategy Session" that routes to "/strategy-session".
All other existing nav links continue to work as before.

requirements.text: Change the "Book Strategy Call" button behavior (site-wide) to open the internal Strategy Session page route ("/strategy-session") using the existing client-side routing pattern (history.pushState + popstate dispatch), so the Strategy Session page opens from the button on all pages.

quotes: The page should open on Book Stratergy Call button from all pages

acceptanceCriteria: Clicking "Book Strategy Call" in the TopNav (desktop and mobile) navigates to "/strategy-session" and renders the StrategySessionPage without a full page reload.
Clicking other CTAs that use the shared booking handler (e.g., "Book Call" in ContactOptionsGrid and CTAs in homepage sections) also navigates to "/strategy-session" from any current route.
After navigation to "/strategy-session", the page is scrolled to the top (consistent with other route navigations in the app).

constraints: Do not edit any files under frontend/src/components/ui (read-only UI components).
Do not modify frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts(x), frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, or frontend/src/main.tsx (immutable paths).
Keep the existing client-side routing approach used in frontend/src/App.tsx and frontend/src/components/TopNav.tsx (no new router library).
nonGoals: Do not remove the Strategy Session page route ("/strategy-session") or its content; only remove the separate navigation link and change CTA behavior.
Do not add or integrate external scheduling providers (Calendly/Cal.com) as part of this change.
Do not change backend lead storage, schemas, or submission behavior.
